snippet: A military judge said that a military detainee, Abd al-Rahim al-Nashiri, can meet with his lawyers without being shackled, so he will not testify now about C.I.A. torture.
abstract: Military judge Col James L Pohl rules that Guantanamo Bay prisoner Abd al-Rahim al-Nashiri can meet with his defense lawyers without being shackled; ruling temporarily averts a hearing by Nashiri concerning his alleged torture by the CIA, testimony that would likely lead to a showdown over the First Amendment and the Obama administration’s military commission trials at Guantanamo Bay.
lead_paragraph: A military judge said that a military detainee, Abd al-Rahim al-Nashiri, can meet with his lawyers without being shackled, so he will not testify now about C.I.A. torture.

headline.main: Ruling Averts Testimony by a Detainee, for Now
headline.print_headline: Ruling Averts Testimony By a Detainee, for Now
